metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10909 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Symfony before 2.7.51, 2.8.x before 2.8.50, 3.x before 3.4.26, 4.xbefore 4.1.12, and 4.2.x before 4.2.7, validation messages are not escaped,which can lead to XSS when user input is included. This is related tosymfony/framework-bundle.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 3.4.22+dfsg-2ubuntu1
php-symfony-amazon-mailer - 3.4.22+dfsg-2ubuntu1
php-symfony-asset - 3.4.22+dfsg-2ubuntu1

criterions.comment: symfony package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.22+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
